Detailed Description

Class for running the Ear Clipping triangulation algorithm on a PointShape.

Calculate the bounding box of a set of three vectors, used by the optomized version of the algorithm.

Parameters:

p2 The second point.
p3 The third point.
minOut The hgeVector to place the bottom left corner of the box into.

TriangleShape *  output1,
TriangleShape *  output2 
)

Convert a PointShape that represents a closed Polygon into a collection of Triangles.

This method uses the original algorithm implementation.

Parameters:
shape A pointer to the shape to be converted.

const hgeVector &  point 
) [private]

Test if a point is inside a triangle, the optomized version that performs a simple bounding box check.

Parameters:
minCoords The bottom left corner of the ears bounding box.
maxCoords The top right corner of the ears bounding box.
v1 The first vertex of the triangle.
v2 The second vertex of the triangle.
v3 The third vertex of the triangle.
point The point to test.

Definition at line 53 of file AlgorithmRunner.cpp.

void AlgorithmRunner::processShapeOptomized ( CyclicVector< hgeVector >  points,
TriangleShape *  output 
) [private]

Non-recursive method used in the conversion process of the optomized version of the algorithm.

The points must be in clockwise order.

Parameters:
points The points to process, adjacency is assumed.
output The TriangleShape to add any cut ears to.

Recursive method used in the conversion process of the original version of the algorithm.

The points must be in clockwise order.

Parameters:
points The points to process, adjacency is assumed.
output The TriangleShape to add any cut ears to.

Definition at line 109 of file AlgorithmRunner.cpp.

bool AlgorithmRunner::vertexConvex ( const hgeVector &  v1,
const hgeVector &  v2,
const hgeVector &  v3 
) [private]

Test if a vertex is convex, finds the area of the triangle formed, if the sign is - the triangle is convex, it is concave otherwise.

This isn't quite the same thing as the real area, which would require the result to be divided by 2. Vertex 2 is the actual vertex to test.

Parameters:
v1 The first vertex.
v2 The second vertex, the one actually tested.
v3 The third vertex.
